notesStmt.note: Tidemark at head, sometimes at edges. Front paper leaves repaired/infilled before rebinding. Incomplete at the end.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 11 quires: i-iii(20), iv(18), v-ix(10), x(14-1) (half of the 6th bifolium is cut off, the other half [folio 137] is heavily mutilated), xi(14-2). Catchwords have been cut off when rebound, but still visible on the unmutilated leaves (lower margins have been folded, not cut).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Byzantine semi-cursive and square script of the 14th century.

binding.p: BM in-house, quarter-bound. Spine: 'He-Aruch. Hebrew. Vol. II. Brit. Mus. Oriental 1265.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Acquired by the British Museum in 1873.
